result.execSummary:
The defendant Shay R. Huegli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shay R. Huegli is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shay R. Huegli was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Shay R. Huegli was found guilty of Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:02 am - DA calls cases 14CF89 and 13CF15 and states appearances.  Defendant Shay R. Huegli appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE waives Preliminary hearing in 14CF89.  Move to plea and sentencing.  DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct 2 and 3 in 14CF89.    Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  Court dismisses Ct 1 on motion of DA.  Court imposes:

Ct 2 - Court costs of $243
$200 DNA surcharge
30 days jail with huber and consecutive to any other.  Jail term is to commence within 30 days of 5/5/15.  Subject to probation agent and continued obedience to bond

Ct 3  Court cost of $243
30 days jail with huber and consecutive to any other.  Jail term is to commence within 30 days of 5/5/15.  Subject to probation agent and continued obedience to bond.  
$65 SBDA

On 13CF15
Sentence withheld, 18 months probation
Conditions of probation
10 days jail with huber consecutive to any other, with 1 day credit for time served.
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment
Court costs of $268
Order DE to submit to a DNA sample.
AODA and followthrough

Pay plan on 14CF89 of $25 per month beg 5/31/15, June and July,  $75 beg 8/30/15 and each month thereafter or CO. 

Appeal rights given

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.    DE may not have contact with Dayne Bottolfson, nor go upon his residence, currently 640 Center St., Prentice or any further residence in the future, unless there is written consent on file.

10:04 am - Defendant Shay R. Huegli appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.    Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
